entry.title: Make SAP change faster, safer, and smarter with continuous delivery and DevOps
entry.content:
Delivering updates, fixes, and new functionality quickly, can be a headache for SAP teams. Business requirements keep shifting and teams need to adapt to those new demands just as fast. If you donâ€™t, you risk falling behind in efficiency, innovation, and customer expectations.

A way forward thatâ€™s proven to work is to move away from large, infrequent releases and deliver changes in smaller chunks. Many SAP teams are already doing this, switching from quarterly deployments to weekly updates, for example.

The benefits of this are obvious: faster delivery, less risk, and far more opportunities to respond to real-time business feedback.

But adopting this agile model isnâ€™t always easy, especially if you are considering or are in the middle of an S/4HANA migration or moving to the Cloud. It requires a shift in mindset, a new way of managing SAP change, and the right automation to support it.

Continuous delivery and DevOps: The foundation for faster SAP change

The idea is to deliver smaller, manageable updates that are ready to be deployed at any moment, with minimal risk. Adopting this continuous delivery approach means you can deploy enhancements and fixes when the business needs them, rather than waiting for next pre-planned change window.

DevOps complements this by breaking down silos between development and operations â€“ the barriers that all too often slow down SAP change.

Together, continuous delivery and DevOps enable:

  • Faster time to value: changes get deployed more quickly and frequently
  • Reduced risk: errors get caught earlier, minimizing unscheduled downtime
  • Better collaboration between technical and business teams, allowing a rapid response when priorities change

Continuous delivery is the how and DevOps is the culture and the mindset that makes it possible.

Why the traditional approach to SAP change delivery falls short

Many SAP organizations still rely on the classic waterfall approach: gather requirements, design, develop, test, and deploy â€“ during a planned outage, of course.

But this is a slow and inflexible way of working that just wonâ€™t cut it in a fast-changing world where business needs continually change.

The problems are real and include:

  • Slow delivery cycles: With a waterfall approach, each phase of a project must be finished before the next can begin. This results in lengthy timelines that can't keep pace with the demands for rapid updates and continuous iteration
  • Increasing landscape complexity: Todayâ€™s SAP landscapes can span on-premises, Cloud and hybrid environments, making change control so much more complicated
  • Resistance to change: Established processes and the familiarity with doing things the way theyâ€™ve always been done can make teams resistant to new ways of working

Bridging the Gap Between Old and New
Adopting DevOps and continuous delivery isnâ€™t about abandoning governance or established change processes. Structured approval gates, risk controls, and audit trails of every change, still have a role to play.

What gets transformed is how change is managed across your SAP landscape, so teams can accelerate delivery while minimizing risk.

In practice this means:

  • Breaking down silos between teams: getting development, operations and business teams working together
  • Standardizing and documenting change processes
  • Establishing a central repository for details related to any ITSM tickets, testing cases and results, and code review confirmation

The Role of Automation in Making It Work
Automation is the foundation that supports DevOps and continuous delivery in SAP. The closer you get to these goals, the more important it is to get rid of manual, error-prone steps from the change process.

An automated, unified platform integrating ALM tools gives you the DevOps results youâ€™re after:

  • More frequent, reliable, and cost-effective SAP change
  • Keeping the right people informed and accountable
  • End-to-end control and traceability of your SAP change workflow

Success relies on a workflow engine that integrates and orchestrates 3rd-party solutions, reducing the time and effort to deploy and maintain SAP applications over their lifetime. You can build a DevOps workflow from the request for change to production deployment. This unified toolchain can be as straightforward or as complex as your organization requires.

Why modernizing SAP change matters
Adopting a DevOps methodology in SAP is not always easy â€“ but itâ€™s not impossible either. You can transform how you manage change across your SAP landscape to achieve continuous delivery and DevOps goals â€“ even if there is no one-size-fits all solution.

Organizations must adapt and evolve SAP change processes to what works best for them. The payoff is significant, though â€“ with faster, safer, and more efficient SAP change, youâ€™ll enjoy minimum downtime, be able to quickly respond to market demands, and ensure better alignment between IT and business stakeholders.

Being able to respond quickly and confidently is not just an operational improvement â€“ it gives your organization a massive competitive edge.

Whatever your DevOps strategy, a workflow engine that integrates and orchestrates a unified toolchain is necessary to meet your objectives.

entry.title: Key Apps for GSTR-6 and ISD Management: India
entry.content:
This blog provides a summary of the apps and their functions required to file GSTR-6 in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (formerly known as SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition).

GSTR-6 is the mandatory monthly return for an Input Service Distributor (ISD),  a critical compliance piece for large enterprises with centralized procurement, such as software companies with multiple offices under the same PAN. The ISD mechanism allows the Head Office to receive input service invoices (like consulting or software licenses) centrally and then distribute the associated Input Tax Credit (ITC) to the unit locations where the services are actually consumed.

The SAP S/4HANA system manages this distribution automatically through ISD program known as J1IG_ISDN . It calculates how much of the total ITC each branch should get. This calculation is usually based on a fair measure, like the turnover (sales) of each branch relative to the others and maintained in configuration settings.

SAP generates special internal documents (ISD invoices) that formally transfer the tax credit to each branch. This allows the individual branches to legally reduce their own tax bill by the credit they received.

Here are the apps that assist users in creating ISD invoices and filing GSTR-6 returns:

  1. Re-distribute and Create ISD Invoices
  2. eDocument Cockpit/ Manage Electronic Documents
  3. Resolve Electronic Document Inconsistencies
  4. Run Statuary Reports

              I.                  Re-distribute and Create ISD Invoices:

    This app helps users to create, display and redistribute Input Service Distribution invoices. Users select the filter criteria like Company code, Fiscal Year, ISD Business Place and selection of documents based on posting date. Further, based on the selection, A processing action can be triggered to view the ISD distribution, Change ISD distribution or to Post ISD distribution and create ISD invoices.

     

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    Re-distribute and Create ISD Invoices

    App ID

    J1IG_ISDN

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_FIN_BC_GLO_GSTISD_IN_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    Globalization - Input Service Distribution for India

    Business Role

    SAP_BR_PURCHASER_IN

    Business Role Description

    Purchaser for India

     

              II.                  EDOCUMENT Cockpit/ Manage Electronic Documents

    Users can use either eDocument Cockpit app or Manage Electronic Document App to work with electronic documents.

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    Manage Electronic Documents

    App ID

    F4306

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_SD_BC_GLO_EDOC_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    Globalization - Electronic Documents

    Business Role

    SAP_BR_BILLING_CLERK

    Business Role Description

    Billing Clerk

     

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    eDocument Cockpit

    App ID

    EDOC_COCKPIT

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_SD_BC_GLO_EDOC_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    Globalization - Electronic Documents

    Business Role

    SAP_BR_BILLING_CLERK

    Business Role Description

    Billing Clerk

    eDocument cockpit app allows users to process electronic documents (eDocuments) that are created automatically based on source documents. Users can display eDocuments, submit documents in XML to external systems and monitor the respective status for subsequent actions.

    What are the differences between the Manage Electronic Documents app and eDocument Cockpit app?

              III.                  Resolve Electronic Document Inconsistencies

    This is the app where users can review inconsistencies in the documents for example a document is available in GSTR-6A but missing in Book of accounts or if a document is missing in Tax authority but available in Book of accounts. Users then decide to accept the documents based on available info or may wait for the correction of the records. Only the accepted documents are picked by ISD distribution program. Please note this is the same action you will be navigated to 'Prepare ITC' action mentioned in following  step IV - Run Statuary Reports.

     

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    Resolve Electronic Document Inconsistencies - India

    App ID

    F8406

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_SD_BC_GLO_EDC_IN_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    Globalization - Electronic Documents Consistency for India

    Business Role

    SAP_BR_BILLING_CLERK_IN

    Business Role Description

    Billing Clerk for India

              IV.                  Run Statuary Reports

    This is the main App where GSTR-6 filing steps are performed. There are 5 actions/steps involved as shown below:

     

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    Run Statutory Reports

    App ID

    F1515

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_FIN_BC_GL_REPORTING_CN_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    General Ledger - Reporting for India

    Business Role

     

    Business Role Description

    General Ledger Accountant for India

    We have gone through the 4 important apps for GSTR-6 Filing. This concludes this blog for GSTR-6 Filing starting from ISD distribution to reconcile and file your returns.  Please ensure you have assigned the required business roles to locate these applications. Refer to Fiori Application Libary for latest information about catalogues, roles and spaces. Further resources can be accessed through SAP Help Portal:

    GSTR6 Report

entry.title: GRC Tuesdays: Tickinâ€™ Off the Policies (GRC Christmas tune)
entry.content:
Like decorating the Christmas tree, baking gingerbread cookies and waiting for Santa to arrive, our yearly GRC Christmas parody has now become a tradition.

Well, maybe not as famous as the other three, but getting there!

Another tradition of course is unwrapping presentsâ€¦ which, for some younger ones, will inevitably be a building brick toy from a very famous Danish company. Did you know that the patent for the toy building brick was lodged in 1958 and that it is possible to combine six 2x4 bricks in 915.103.765 different ways? I donâ€™t know about you but I surely stepped 915.103.765 times on Lego bricks hidden on the carpet!

Getting back to our topic today but staying in 1958 because itâ€™s the time of the year to fully embrace nostalgia, this is also the year that Rockin' Around the Christmas Tree was released.

Our GRC Christmas tune will therefore be inspired by this all-time classic!

So, leave your Legos on the table (not on the carpet!) and join me in singing our 2025 Tickinâ€™ Off the Policies parody.

 

  

 

Background:

The day is Tuesday 16th of December 2025, our GRC lead is finalizing his compliance training and making sure that all controls are in place to run smoothly over the holidays to protect the organization and its business.

 

Tickin' off the policies

Before shutting my laptop

 

Data privacyâ€™s the key

Wish Iâ€™d gone to the workshop

 

Year-end's near, finally

And vacation time coming

 

One last exception to deny

And I'll send the reporting

 

Can't wait for my audit lead to send me his cheer

When he sees no anomaly

Weâ€™ll celebrate merrily!

 

Screen' all our 3rd party

Making sure they are okay

 

Checkin' blocked payments to prevent any delay

 

[ðŸŽº trumpets ]

 

There is just one last item I need to clear

 

IT checks for security

1st line users will be happy

 

Control testin' activity

Automated all the way

 

That's how GRC should be carried anyway!

 

[ðŸŽº trumpets ]

 

I hope you enjoyed this last GRC Tuesdays post of the year. Thank you for following us once again in 2025, reading, sharing and commenting on these blogs and I sincerely hope you will continue to do so in 2026.

As usual, if youâ€™d like to get in touch, feel free to add a note on this blog.

Finally, in case youâ€™d like to continue singing GRC Christmas tunes, below are links to our previous beats:

  • 2024 â€“ GRC Tuesdays: Last Christmas... I Wasnâ€™t Exemplar! (GRC Christmas tune)

We have attribute called privileges_with_grant_options, as per my knowledge , this attribute states what kind of privileges can be offered by a object_owner to application_user . 

In my project I have mentioned "SELECT" in my privileges_with_grant_options for Role# and I have mentioned "SELECT" , "INSERT" under privileges for Role.

Object Owner Role 

{
    "role":{
        "name":"EXTERNAL_ACESS_READ_G#",
        "object_privileges": [
            {
                "name":"PRODUCERNAMESPACE_PRODUCT",
                "type": "TABLE",
              
                "privileges_with_grant_option":["SELECT"] 
            }
        ]
    }
}

 Application User role 

{

        "object_privileges": [

                "privileges": [

entry.title: SAPâ€™s Golden Certificate as a Benchmark: KPNâ€™s Commitment to Quality
entry.content:
SAPâ€™s Golden Certificate has been awarded to our partner KPN B.V. following the certification of its SAP operations and services for the tenth consecutive time. This milestone reflects more than two decades of a continuous journey with SAP, driven by a strong commitment to quality, trust, and innovation. We deeply value our enduring partnership and appreciate KPNâ€™s willingness to share their insights and experiences on how certification has played a central role in strengthening customer confidence and shaping KPNâ€™s service portfolio. From early SAP HANA adoption to todayâ€™s cloud solutions such as SAP S/4HANA, RISE with SAP, and SAP BTP, KPN has continuously expanded its SAP capabilities.

 
Could you start by telling us about your company and the services you offer?

At KPN, weâ€™re proud to be the Netherlandsâ€™ leading provider of telecommunications and IT services. Our unique combination of a secure, nationwide network and privately owned data centers empowers us to deliver critical SAP environments for both national and international clients. For nearly 30 years, our dedicated SAP team has been at the forefront, offering expert consultancy, managed services, and 24/7 support. Our customers benefit from our proven track record and deep expertise, ensuring their SAP systems are secure, stable, and ready for the future. As cloud solutions like SAP BTP become increasingly vital, we guide our customers through every step of their digital transformation, acting as a trusted advisor and technical partner.

 

As an SAP partner for more than 24 years, how has your partnership evolved, and what have been the most significant milestones or highlights in your collaboration with SAP?

Our partnership with SAP is a story of continuous innovation and shared success. For over two decades, weâ€™ve been one of the most consistently certified SAP service providers in the Netherlands, a testament to our commitment and expertise. Highlights include our early adoption of SAP HANA, the integration of certified disaster recovery across multiple data centers, and our expansion into SAP Cloud services. Each achievement has enabled our customers to innovate with confidence and resilience. Our recent certification as an SAP BTP Operations Partner marks another proud milestone, reflecting our dedication to supporting our customersâ€™ evolving needs. Looking ahead, weâ€™re excited to deepen our expertise in SAP Cloud security and AI, ensuring our customers remain at the cutting edge.

 

What inspired your decision to seek your first service certification in 2001, and how do you assess that choice today?

Looking back, our decision to pursue SAP certification in 2001 was driven by a passion for excellence and a desire to earn our customersâ€™ trust. We recognized early on that independent validation was essential, not just for us, but for our customersâ€™ peace of mind. Today, weâ€™re proud that this commitment continues to set us apart. Maintaining our certifications remains crucial, reassuring our customers, strengthening our reputation, and often making the difference in competitive bids. This commitment to quality and trust forms the foundation of our success, and we value the confidence it brings to our customers every day.

 

Handover of the golden certificate, November 2025

 

SAP is strongly focusing on the cloud and encourages partners to support customers in their migration journey. Do you plan to further expand your cloud-related services, and how are you already helping customers in this area?

Absolutely! As cloud adoption accelerates, weâ€™re investing heavily in expertise, solutions, and tooling to help our customers make a safe and successful transition. We guide customers through end-to-end migrations to SAP S/4HANA and RISE with SAP, delivering managed cloud services, including security, monitoring, and seamless integration with our robust network infrastructure. Our unique position as both a connectivity and SAP services provider ensures our customers enjoy secure, future-ready cloud journeys. Looking ahead, weâ€™re excited to expand our offerings in cloud security and AI-driven automation, empowering our customers to achieve even greater success.

 

You were recently certified for the first time for SAP BTP operations. What experiences have you gained with SAP BTP in recent years, and what motivated you to pursue this certification at this point in your companyâ€™s evolution?

We saw that many of our customers were eager to unlock the full potential of SAP BTP, but often found it challenging to manage the platformâ€™s complexity, especially around monitoring, security, and operational excellence. By investing in SAP BTP expertise and achieving official certification, we ensure our customers can rely on us for secure, reliable, and optimized BTP operations. This milestone reflects our ambition to stay ahead of technological developments and our commitment to supporting our customersâ€™ innovation journeys. Together, we embrace every step forward in making SAP BTP a powerful asset for our clients.

 

How would you describe your experience with the audits? Do they provide any valuable insights or ideas for further improvement?

We welcome the audit process as a valuable opportunity to reflect, improve, and benchmark our services against the highest standards. While preparing for an audit is demanding, the thoroughness and professionalism of SAPâ€™s auditors always lead to constructive feedback and fresh ideas. We carefully review every audit report and translate recommendations into concrete actions, ensuring we continuously raise the bar for our customers. These audits not only strengthen our partnership with SAP but also motivate us as a team to take pride in our achievements and strive for continuous improvement.

 

Information on the certification program for operations partners and an overview of all certified partners can be found in the SAP Operations Partner Guide.

Visit OPC at SAP.com or on the SAP Partner Portal.

entry.title: Re: 'Starting new task' process is not send to sp01
entry.content:
I guess you mean you are using Batch Input ("Call Transaction Using").

In general, a spool request can be generated if you call an RFC-enabled function (via Starting New Task or whatever) and Call Transaction Using.

In your case, I don't know why the spool request is not generated. Don't forget to catch all errors (in Batch Input, "S" messages can be failures, e.g. S349(00)). You have to debug the standard. NB: the print logic often happens inside the update task, so activate the update debug.

entry.title: Re: Attachments / Folder Permissions
entry.content:
Hi,

the best workaround would be that you set up separate folders for each user in your attachments folder, and then assigning the per user via User Defaults. Next step would be settup up permissions per folder so that each user can read all others, and only modify his own. In this way you have users who can upload attachments, but cannot modify other peoples documents.

BR,

Matija

entry.title: Email Attachment Truncation for Spool Output in Custom Batch Job (ZCP_AP_DAILY_BP****
entry.content:
Hello Expert,
please provide your inputs.

Description:

We have a custom batch job ZCP_AP_DAILY_**** that sends daily Business Partner (BP) changes to the C&P Governance team via email. Recently, the Governance team reported that certain BP data changes are missing from the reports they receive.

Issue Observed:

  • Upon testing in the Q40 environment, we found that when the spool output exceeds approximately 100 pages, the email attachment only contains data equivalent to around 16 pages.(1000lines)
  • This appears to be a limitation in how the spool is processed or converted for email delivery.

Analysis Done:

  • Checked with the Development team, and they confirmed that the issue is due to the spool-to-email conversion process.
  • They suggested creating a custom program to send the complete spool details via email instead of relying on the current mechanism.

    Question to Community:

    • Has anyone faced similar issues with spool output truncation when sending via email?
    • Are there any standard SAP solutions or best practices to handle large spool outputs without losing data?

      Additional Details:

      Current environment:  S/4HANA 

      Thanks &Regards,
      Debi

entry.title: Re: Adobe forms: num.currency{} not working in test envir...
entry.content:
Output of the display pattern: num.currency{} depends on the locale that is used for rendering.
Locale can be hardcoded into the template or set dynamically.
You cannot set the currency symbol manually to this pattern, the currency symbol is automatically determined based on the locale.

In your case I assume that the test report is setting the locale to en_US or a not supported one (which will fallback to en_US).

Locale is passed to the print process via the FM, that is retrieved with: FP_FUNCTION_MODULE_NAME.
Have a look at the fields: LANGU / COUNTRY of structure: SFPDOCPARAMS

Best regards
Pascal

entry.title: Re: Story creation error on Manage KPIs and Reports app
entry.content:
Dear @Kazuhiro_F,

I'll describe step by step what you should do to solve the problem:

  1. In SAP S/4 Hana Public Cloud, open the Maintain Business Roles application and add the SAP_BR_ANALYTICS_SPECIALIST roles
  2. To the role above add the catalog: SAP_CORE_BC_SSB_PC and Save
  3. Ask your administrator or, if you have access, log in to Cloud Identity Services (screen)

 

1. Choose Identity Provisioning and Source Systems

 

2. In the left panel, select your system, next Jobs and Run Now like on screen

 

3. Refresh SAP S/4 Hana Public Cloud system and try create Stories without Error

More details below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3548537

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Enhancing Safety and Efficiency â€“ How SAP S/4HANA Transforms Dangerous Goods Management
entry.content:
Managing dangerous goods in todayâ€™s global supply chains is not only about meeting regulations, it plays a key role in keeping people safe and protecting the environment while also making sure business operations keep running smoothly. Manual processes or disconnected systems can quickly lead to delays, mistakes, and unnecessary risks.

SAP S/4HANA for Product Compliance and its Dangerous Goods Management capabilities can close this gap. By simplifying and automating dangerous goods processes instead of relying on spreadsheets or outdated information, companies can handle their dangerous goods confidently and efficiently without slowing down their operations. Product Compliance comes with embedded regulatory content like UN classifications, hazard labels, shipping names, and transport permissions. So, with that, products can be classified correctly and handled safely throughout the entire supply chain.

What for me really stands out is the integration into everyday business processes. The system automatically calculates and checks transport permissions and flags missing or incomplete classification data. This stops non-compliant shipments before the products leave the warehouse. With built-in analytics, teams can gain a clear overview of regulatory requirements, which makes it much easier to act proactively.

What the video is about:

  • How SAP S/4HANA simplifies classification and global transport management for dangerous goods
  • How embedded regulatory content supports safety and compliance
  • How automated checks and documentation reduce errors, delays, and manual work
  • How analytics provide transparency across the supply chain

This topic is specially close to me because safety and compliance belong together. When theyâ€™re built into daily processes and supported by automation, they donâ€™t slow teams down. They actually make work easier while reducing risks and building trust across the organization and beyond.

SAP Video - In brief: SAP Product Compliance - Dangerous Goods

Watch the video to see how SAP S/4HANA for Product Compliance can help your organization handle dangerous goods safely and turn regulatory requirements into a real advantage.

entry.title: Filtering records based on measure value when copying data via Data Action in SAC
entry.content:
Dear Community
I have a planning model in SAC called Merge, which is built by merging data from many planning models, one of them is a model called HR (containing employee information).

Currently, I use Data Actions to copy data from the source models into the Merge model. For the HR model, the data is loaded via an Upload Job (every month) and then transferred to the Merge model using a Data Action.

However, in the Merge model I only need employee records where the measure IST is not null / not equal to 0. 
Therefore, when copying data from the HR model into the Merge model, all records where IST = 0 should be excluded. In other planning scenarios I need all data in HR model, so I cannot simply delete it at source.

All involved models share two public dimensions: Cost Center and Company Code.

The challenge is that when copying data from one model to another via a Data Action, filters can only be applied to dimensions, not to measures (at lest to my knowledge). Unfortunately, I donâ€™t see a way to create a calculated dimension in the planning model that could be used for filtering (for example: if IST = 0 then Exclude = X).

I already tried the following workaround:

  • Create an intermediate model (HR_NEW) using a Data Action:

  • First, copy the relevant data from the HR model
  • Then, delete the records where IST = 0:
    IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "IST") = 0 THEN
    DELETE()
    ENDIF
  • Use this intermediate model (HR_NEW) as the data source for the Merge model

This solution works only as long as the intermediate model has no public dimensions, which makes it unusable in my case.

Does anyone have an idea how these HR data (excluding IST = 0) could be transferred correctly into the Merge model?

Thanks in advance for any suggestions!
Wiola

@N1kh1l @Chris1973

entry.title: Bulk Download Of Payslips - SAP Payroll
entry.content:
Introduction :

Ever Wondered if there was a Way to download Payslips of Employees in Bulk? Well, It is Possible with Spool Requests. Compensation Team always find difficult to download Payslips of employees one by one for Backup /Audit Requirements.

Here's the Breakdown of Configurations to achieve this!

 Access the Transaction HRFORMS and Choose the Custom / Standard Pay slip that is being Used

Double Click on the Form and open in Change Mode

Click on the Selection Screen Tab and Check the Number of Employees per Form and Save and Activate the Form

On the Top Left Corner , Click Form -> Print Program (Test)

Specify the Number of Employees You want to be downloaded in Bulk in One form and Save as Variant

Access the Transaction PC00_M99_CEDT_MULTIP

Choose the Payroll Area , Payroll Period and navigate to the Report and Variant

 

Choose HRFORMS

Enter your Country Grouping , Form Name and Variant

Before Executing the Creation of Payslips , Make sure the User does not have default output device set as LP01 and Print Now should be Disabled.

The Bulk Payslip should be created as a Spool Request which can be viewed from SP02.

View the Spool Request from SP02 and Click on Overall View on , All the Payslips will merged into One File and it can be downloaded.

Pro Tip :

You can split the PDF and rename it with Employee ID - Employee Name by using Third-Party Tool Sejda.

Conclusion:

The Following Configuration was done as a part of requirement from one of the leading banks in Bahrain and Client was super happy about the Bulk Download of Payslips and with Sejda things have got even better where they were able to save it using ID - Name with just a click of a Button. Features like this really improve the operational efficiency and saves a lot of time and Man Power.

entry.title: Re: Step-by-Step Guide to Data Migration Cockpit in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
@S0027070337 
it always depends on the complexity of an object template (number of sheets and fields that you must fill out), the number of records and the number of systems you need to import this. The more fields you need to enter and the more systems you need to import that data, the more it make sense to enter this within the migration template and then upload the data.

As cost and profit center are from low complexity it is probably faster to enter the single cost center and profit center manually instead of filling the template and then upload them via the cockpit. We internally say that for business objects with less than 20 instances per migration into a system, it makes no sense to create a migration object as the effort to create an object is much much higher, than entering the data manually.
Hope that helps.

BR
Frank

P.S. It is better to ask such questions in Q&A area and not as a comment within a blog.
